name: Hilton Garden Inn Dallas/Market Center

reviews.text: Stayed there two nights in November and found it to be a good value factoring in free parking. The room we checked into had a bad smell coming from the restroom. We informed the front desk as we left for dinner and they had a new room ready for us when we returned. Since they quickly solved the problem we didn't think twice about it. The location isn't exactly ideal for restaurants or nightlife, but is only a couple of miles out of downtown. We highly recommend eating mexican at Pappasito's and beers at Humperdink's. Both of these places are just a few miles north of the hotel on Stemmons Freeway. Overall the hotel looked pretty new and the rooms were nice. We would consider staying here again if the price was right compared to downtown hotels.
reviews.title: Above average hotel

reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I was notably wary as a female business guest travelling alone. However, I felt safe at the hotel and the front desk staff was very courteous. I stayed here as part of the American Heart Association convention, so there were plenty of travellers here. Maybe that was the difference.
reviews.title: Better than expected
Very bad staff
reviews.text: The room was very spacious and clean. The free internet service worked without a problem. The room smelled fresh, the fridge worked great, and I didn't have a problem with the TV reception at all. The continental breakfast was good with a wide selection of food, about $8, and $2 extra for the hot items.
The one reviewer was right -- there really are no close restaurants within walking distance and it is a little confusing getting on and off the highway.
reviews.title: Overall good experience
Football, Beer, and more
reviews.text: If I'm in Dallas again for a convention, I would definitely consider staying here again.

I had reservations with this property since May for a September event. Days before arrival they call me to explain they have oversold their hotel and they are moving my reservation to a property 8 miles from the event I am attending!
reviews.title: Don't expect to have your confirmation numbers kept!
OK, but could be a lot better
reviews.text: So don't think just because you have a reservation with them you will get a room.

We stayed here because it was close to the downtown area. In fact there is not much around it, certainly nothing within walking distance. The first night we hoped to get something to eat but found the restaurant was closing at 9 though it was a Friday night. The woman at the front desk said she would ask the staff to keep it open a couple of minutes so we could order. We brought our stuff to the room and then went to the restaurant where the manager curtly told us that they were no longer serving food, that it did not matter what the woman at the front desk said, and then turned his back on us and left. The woman at the desk could provide little other information on restaurants in the area so we ended up driving around for an hour till we found something. The hotel itself was bland and looked a little soiled. Temperatures inside seemed to be in the 60's. The room was adequate but not more. There is an athletic center and business center and the tiniest outdoor pool you will probably ever see. There is plenty of parking and the highway is easy to reach. It is an ok place to stay. It is not nightmarish. But neither is it a place that is pleasant to stay.
reviews.title: Good hotel, so-so location

reviews.text: I was pleased with this hotel, but am not sure I would stay here again because of the location. It only took me about 5 minutes to get to downtown, which was great, but there are NO restaurants near this hotel. Next time, I'd probably stay a little further from downtown to be closer to restaurants. Plus, were this hotel not right next to the Hilton Anatole, I might say it's not in such a great looking neighborhood (unlike a previous reviewer, I did not see any vagrants in the area).
reviews.title: Satisfied with this hotel

reviews.text: My room was large, quiet, very clean and very comfortable. The bed and shower were both great. I did have to switch rooms during my stay due to a dead air conditioner (not too surprised... Dallas in August). Very few TV channels compared to most hotels nowadays. No problems with the wired internet service.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Dallas/Market Hotel Dallas
description: Set blocks from freeway access to downtown Dallas, this Dallas Market Center hotel puts you at the heart of the Metroplex. Work in our complimentary 24-hour business center or from your room with complimentary WiFi access. Choose your favorites at Great American Grill®’s cooked-to-order breakfast. Wind down with a beer in the Pavilion Lounge, and use your in-room microwave to make snacks from the 24-hour Pavilion Pantry. Our hotel also provides a modern fitness center and refreshing outdoor pool. Host Dallas meetings for 3-300 on the doorstep of Dallas corporations such as IBM and Bank of America. Settle into our guest rooms featuring a microwave, refrigerator and complimentary HBO provide the comforts of home. Stay connected at the large desk or from the comfort of your bed, with complimentary WiFi access. Airport transportation to/from Dallas Love Field. We are a 100% non-smoking hotel.
